attributes.action: Remove the new Court Charge imposed in March 2015
attributes.additional_details: If you plead not guilty to a summary only (magistrates court) offence and are found guilty after trial you will pay a court charge of £750. With prosecution costs and the victim surcharge this means that you can pay well over £1,000 for not paying for a Mars bar. Yet you use a mobile phone whilst driving or drive at excessive speeds and get a penalty of £100. This is clearly wrong as sentencing guidelines for magistrates say that the punishment should be relevant to the offence.
attributes.background: The government introduced a new court charge in March 2015 which means that everyone convicted of a crime at a court of law has to pay a court charge. This means that for trivial of offences if you go to court you could pay over £1000 in financial penalties. PUNISHMENTS SHOULD FIT THE CRIME!
